"Mock" Garlic Mashed Potatoes

"Mock" Garlic Mashed Potatoes

Recipe courtesy George Stella

Show: Low Carb and Lovin' ItEpisode: Low Carb Comfort Foods

Rated: 5 stars out of 5Rate itRead users' reviews (239)

  • Filed under: Cheese, Cream cheese, Vegetables, Cauliflower,
    more
    • Cuisine : American , General
    • Occasion : Holiday
    • CookingStyle : Healthy
    • Herbs & Spices : Garlic
    • Season : Spring , Winter
  • RECIPE
  • RATINGS & REVIEWS(239)

  • Cook Time:

    6 min

  • Level:

    Easy

  • Yield:

    4 servings

Close

Times:

Prep
15 min
Inactive Prep
--
Cook
6 min
Total:
21 min

Add To My Recipe Box

Please sign in to add this recipe to your Recipe Box!!

Sign In or Create Your Recipe Box

Ingredients

  • 1 medium head cauliflower
  • 1 tablespoon cream cheese, softened
  • 1/4 cup grated Parmesan
  • 1/2 teaspoon minced garlic
  • 1/8 teaspoon straight chicken base or bullion (may substitute 1/2 teaspoon salt)
  • 1/8 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
  • 1/2 teaspoon chopped fresh or dry chives, for garnish
  • 3 tablespoons unsalted butter

Directions

Set a stockpot of water to boil over high heat.

Clean and cut cauliflower into small pieces. Cook in boiling water for about 6 minutes, or until well done. Drain well; do not let cool and pat cooked cauliflower very dry between several layers of paper towels.

In a bowl with an immersion blender, or in a food processor, puree the hot cauliflower with the cream cheese, Parmesan, garlic, chicken base, and pepper until almost smooth.

Garnish with chives, and serve hot with pats of butter.

Hint: Try roasting the garlic and adding a little fresh rosemary for a whole new taste.

Chef: George Stella

  • By JimCakalic

    on April 13, 2011

    Flag

    Flag This Review?

    Please provide the reason why you think this review is inappropriate.

    • Flag Review

    or Cancel

    Made these because my wife is on the Atkins diet again. Expected them to be very "cauliflower" tasting but they weren't. Perhaps because they're boiled? My picky eater daughter, who loves potatoes in just about any form, was impressed. If anybody could tell the difference it would have been her. Followed the recipe per ingredients but didn't pat the cauliflower dry so they ended up a little runny but I threw them in the oven at 350 for about 15 minutes while I finished the other components of dinner and they came out great - maybe even better. I'll definitely be making this again.

    people found this review Helpful.
    Was this review helpful to you? Yes | No
